title: Calories in Cabernet Sauvignon
meta_description: Discover calories in cabernet sauvignon per standard glass, including carbs, alcohol content, and nutrition breakdowns for this dry red wine.
assumptions: Standard 5 oz (147 ml) serving of dry cabernet sauvignon wine, ~13% ABV, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, vintage, alcohol content, and serving size. Check labels for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One 5 oz glass of cabernet sauvignon has ~125 kcal, mostly from alcohol and minimal carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of cabernet sauvignon?
faqs.a: About 125 kcal for a standard 5 oz serving.
Yes, around 3.8 g carbs per glass, mostly from residual sugars.

faqs.q: Is cabernet sauvignon low in sugar?
faqs.a: Dry varieties have ~1 g sugar per glass; sweeter ones may have more.

faqs.q: What affects calories in cabernet sauvignon?
faqs.a: Alcohol percentage, serving size, and residual sugar levels primarily influence calories.

faqs.q: Are there fats or proteins in cabernet sauvignon?
faqs.a: Negligibleâ€”0 g fat and ~0.1 g protein per glass.
